Pre-Game Insights: The money line odds have the Twins at -160, while the Reds are the slight underdog at +136.
The over/under line is sitting at 8.5 runs.
David Festa will be starting for the Twins, while the Reds are sending Rhett Lowder to the mound.
Cincinnati is 73-77 this season and has won two straight, putting them 4th in the NL Central.
The Twins are 3rd in the AL Central but have lost two in a row.
Cincinnati cruised to an easy 11-1 win over the Twins in the most recent game of this series.
Nick Martinez pitched well for the Reds in this one, going six innings and giving up just one run.
Simeon Woods Richardson had a rough outing for the Twins, giving up three earned runs in just three innings of work.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Reds have won two straight games as the underdog, and they are 40-44 as the underdog overall.
Their record as the favorite is currently 33-33.
Cincinnati's overall series record is 18-27-3, and they are looking to close out this series with a win, leading 2-0 so far.
Rhett Lowder will be making his third start of the season for the Reds, and this time it will be on the road against the Twins.
Elly De La Cruz has been a bright spot for the Reds this season, as his 24 home runs are the most on the team, and he is batting.257 for the season.
Spencer Steer is the team's top run producer, as his 88 RBIs are 15th in the league, and he is 3rd on the team with 19 homers.
Jeimer Candelario is also near the top of the Reds' home run leaderboard, with 20 long balls, but like Steer, he has struggled with his batting average this season, coming in at just.225.
Others: TJ Friedl and Jake Fraley each homered for the Reds, while Jonathan India scored twice and drove in two runs while going 2/4.
Noelvi Marte also had a two-hit game at the plate.
The Twins are averaging 4.7 runs per game, which is 11th in the league.
They have been a better offense at home, averaging 4.9 runs per game.
Overall, they are the 9th ranked home run hitting team in the league and have the 8th best team batting average in the MLB.
